results.title: Director of Growth
results.description:
Director of Growth

Type: Full-Time

Location: Remote

Company Background: Seventh Dimension LLC provides focused customer support in two core competencies Training & Support Services. Since 2015, we have provided customers with flexible, adaptable, and creative approaches to solving complex problems. We are a proven prime contractor that understands future operating environments, fiscal constraints, and current force requirements. We are a SDVOSB in North Carolina conducting operations and supporting contracts globally.

Position Summary: Overall, this position is responsible for generating new income business opportunities for Seventh Dimension in support of strategic initiatives. The Director of Growth is responsible for filling and maintaining the Seventh Dimension's opportunity pipeline, executing the BD process, maintaining a high Probability of Win for those opportunities selected for capture and bid, and in general growing business within the DoD, Federal Agencies, and target markets.

As the Director of Growth, you will focus on 10-12 opportunities below $5M annually / 4-6 opportunities between $5M and $10M annually / 2-3 opportunities above $10M annually. These opportunities can be a mixture of prime and subcontract opportunities with the expectation of 50% to be prime opportunities.

You will be part of an amazing team to identify and develop opportunities for business expansion. Seventh Dimension understands the importance of quality of work life as an essential investment to the stability and prosperity of the company. We take pride in knowing this impacts our employees and customers. This position is a critical addition to Seventh Dimension growth campaign which has tripled over the past two years.

Responsibilities:

• Identify and develop opportunities for business expansion and close on existing opportunities already in the pursuit pipeline in our growing business.

• Build relationships and foster business within our capability areas (Training, Exercise Support, and Service Support) with DoD and Federal customers

• Conduct opportunity research and qualification, leads capture and pre-proposal activities and arranges / coordinates business development meetings supported by Corporate Leadership

• Responsible for development and implementation of an integrated action/contact plan based upon capture analysis. This includes aiding in all required pursuit planning and ensuring opportunities are accurately reflected in the pipeline management system

• Support and informs proposal review, leads proposal solutioning, supports pricing analysis, and coordinates with Technical Subject Matter Experts to develop proposal strategies and technical content

• Lead win theme development, develops and maintains a detailed capture plan and provides capture status updates at capture reviews

• Effectively interacting with colleagues and executives in a collaborative environment

Requirements:

• An active DoD Secret clearance

• A Bachelor's degree or higher (experience in lieu of degree can be substituted with 10 years government contracting experience)

• 10+ years' experience growing and fostering business within the DoD and Federal Agencies

• Candidates must have an understanding of the roles of the various functions within a defense contracting business and have an in-depth understanding of U.S. Department of Defense Solicitations and RFPs.

• Strong research and analytical skills for business analytics and business development

• Understanding of Work Breakdown Structures, typical Proposal sections and evaluation criteria

• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel functionality and formulas is required, working knowledge of Microsoft Word.

• Good interpersonal skills are important as well as high quality work, attention to detail, and the ability to work within time constraints.

Travel: Ability to travel up to 15%

DISCLAIMER: The listed duties are not intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification, only a representative summary of primary duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional position specific duties.

Seventh Dimension, LLC is a Veteran friendly employer and provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
About Kittl

With Kittl we are building the most intuitive and easy-to-use design platform for creators. Creating beautiful designs can be a long and painful process. We decided to tackle this problem heads-on and have built Kittl.com to provide an alternative to professional tools. With offices in Berlin and Dusseldorf, we are a diverse team of 25 creators - hailing from 10+ nationalities.

 

Your mission
As one of the first Product Managers at Kittl you will lead and develop a fast-paced and test-driven product management culture with us. The role needs laser-focus on understanding our user base, whilst finding solutions for providing the best possible user experience that you can express in activation, retention or engagement metrics to drive our core kpis. You will prioritize what to test next and design lean MVPs that can be run quickly and ultimately lead into new product features. Thanks to our active user base we can constantly have immediate feedback on tests which brings lot's of excitement to our work. It is our goal to run significant tests as fast and much as possible. Together with us you will be shaping the structure that will allow other product managers to join and take over their own work streams independently. You will collaborate closely with a team of engineers, designers, growth managers and and the founders, who all strive to make Kittl the most empowering design platform.

 

Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Define and develop a test-driven product management culture with us
  • Build up a deep understanding of user needs and behavior, market and competitive landscape
  • Drive hypothesis-driven product testing and facilitate continuous learning from data and user insights
  • Enable your team in building and shipping features effectively and meeting roadmap milestones by understanding technical and design trade-offs, removing roadblocks, and validating problems & solutions prior to investing in them
  • Create and develop clear KPIs / metrics to measure impact and report progress
  • Min. 3+ years of experience in product management, ideally in a high-growth environment
  • Proven ability to define a winning product-culture
  • Well-founded knowledge of the techniques and methods of product discovery and delivery
  • Experience in making informed decisions based on qualitative user insights and quantitative user data by conducting user research, A/B tests, and analyzing data
  • Hands-on approach with a proven track record in taking ownership of problems independently and driving measurable results
  • Clear communication style with the ability to develop well-structured and data-informed narratives
  • Well organized and know how to separate noise from the important things even in busy times
Benefits & why you should join us

Join one of the hottest start-ups in graphic design to shape the future of graphic creation and enjoy a very open, transparent and performance driven company culture with a fast and agile development cycle. You'll work closely with and learn from a passionate and talented founding team.

  • You’ll work on an exciting new product
  • You’ll work with an amazing team of talented people
  • Flexible working culture where progress counts
  • Competitive compensation and equity package in full-time roles

Also we have snacks, coffee, regular team dinners and rooftop parties ;)

If that sounds interesting to you let's get in touch.

results.title: Senior Design Researcher
results.description:
A little about Glorify..

Glorify is a fast-growing business on a mission to become the world’s largest digital platform for the 2.5 billion Christians worldwide. We are looking for a Senior Research Designer team working in an industry that has been left mostly untouched by tech. This position is perfect for you if you are motivated and excited about being a part of something from the ground floor!

 

Glorify utilizes bite-size readings, meditations, music and gamification techniques to enable people to spend daily time with God. Having successfully launched in key Christian markets in the UK, US, and Latin America, Glorify has achieved over 6 million downloads and millions of monthly active users; Both through individuals and organizations.

*We emphasize that you don't need to be a Christian to work here. You do however need to share our passion in striving for excellence in everything that we do. Our main focus is on growing a fantastic team who puts the needs of our users first.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to define the most important research questions, scope and conduct research to address those, and identify the most relevant and actionable insights.
  • Draw on your expertise in qualitative research methods to establish trust, openness, and care with participants and uncover deep insights about our current and future Members’ needs.
  • Conduct remote and occasionally in-person research using a variety of qualitative methods (contextual inquiry, ethnographic observation, diary studies, interviews, co-design and co-creation) focused primarily on the discovery phase of projects and to also include work on validation & usability testing, as needed.
  • Creatively and compellingly share the insights and human stories uncovered in your research.
  • Serve as an active voice and advocate for human-centered product and service improvements grounded in your research that help better serve our Users and Communities.
  • Help teach and guide other designers and cross-functional teams in how to understand customer problems, apply research insights to generate solutions to those problems, and design and validate these solutions.
  • Help bring new offerings to life that meet discovered human needs.

Requirements

Preferred Experience:

  • 5+ hands on years of experience
  • Excellent storytelling, facilitation, and collaboration skills
  • Deep fluency with the human-centered design process and an ability to teach and guide teams through each stage
  • Deep qualitative research experience and ideally familiarity with integrating quantitative analysis and other mixed methods approaches
  • Familiarity with remote ethnography, survey, and usability tools to include dscout, Typeform, SurveyMonkey, UserTesting.com, and/or User Interviews
  • Fluency with rapid prototyping and experience advising on evaluative research efforts

Benefits

  • Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision
  • Competitive compensation
  • Paid time off
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Access to Perks At Work
  • Business travel accident insurance

About Glorify

Glorify is the #1 Christian Daily Worship app. With more than 6 million of downloads to date. This is Glorify’s unique approach: we make it simple for Individuals and Businesses alike to build daily devotional habits and provide a bridge between individuals and God. Through guided meditations, Biblical passages, devotional, prayer and music playlists. Glorify is headquartered in London, founded from a core belief to curate a space and structure for our users to connect with the Christian community every day . To learn more, follow Glorify on Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Glorify, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Glorify are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

results.title: Account Director, Sports
results.description:
Company Description

At Viral Nation, we specialize in building social-first ecosystems for brands to connect with the modern consumer journey. Our integrated solutions align strategy, talent, media, and technology with culturally relevant creativity to scale the world’s fastest-growing digital brands.  Viral Nation offers a fluid, creative, and growth-oriented environment that will support your ambitions to apply your talents in an open, collaborative, and fast-paced culture. We’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver strategies, and we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay at the forefront of the industry has fueled our success and will guide us in paving the path forward.

 2021 was a transformational year for Viral Nation, having grown by 200% and we have even bigger ambitions for 2022 and beyond.  While we continuously exceed our goals, we need your help – our success is only as great as our people.  Strong performance leads to high expectations and we need to keep raising the bar!

Our Values

We Constantly Evolve: Embracing change is both an opportunity and a necessity!

Courage: Challenging the norm drives us forward!

Diversity: We strive for excellence and recognize that our differences make us stronger. We respect and seek out the inclusion of differences, realizing we can learn from each other!

Resilience: Adversity is a springboard for growth!

Viral Nation is seeking a dedicated Account Director, Sports with a robust mix of influencer marketing, social & digital media, analytics, and content marketing experience who will help achieve the maximum impact of the brand story. By nature, they are a confident, courageous and strategic leader who excels in building bulletproof relationships with both their clients as well as their internal team. They are known to bring value to every conversation and know when and how to challenge the status quo within our ever-changing industry. 

The Account Director, Sports is accountable for leading, retaining and growing their dedicated portfolio of clientele. They lead the day-to-day execution of client programs and elevate brand storytelling, insights and analytics. They know the components needed for flawless execution, and delivery, and push for exceptionally creative and unique work across a mix of global clientele. They lead the account teams responsible for influencer engagement, paid social and measurement, in addition to creative ideation, managing briefs, building and managing client relationships, presenting concepts, developing proposals and delivering clear POVs on trends that impact clients’ business. 



Job Description
  • Establish and grow a strong relationship with multiple senior client stakeholders through a demonstration of industry knowledge and the application to business challenges and growing and driving revenue 
  • Establish and maintain relationships with all key stakeholders 
  • Hands-on leader with execution and negotiation for Celeb, Celeb Influencer and Macro talent
  • Liaises and orchestrates directly with all internal teams 
  • Manage & coach a team of 15-20 members through navigation of client challenges and campaign executions
  • Create pitches and RFP’s 
  • Identify and understand problem-solving techniques and facilitate a process to solve issues (internally and externally)
  • Proactively keep abreast of industry trends and implications on client business 
  • Develop and motivate the Account team to deliver the highest standards in leadership, insight, delivery, and spirit in the industry, as seen by clients and internal partners
  • Mentor the team to maximize individuals’ growth, and harness the strengths and opportunities of each team member



Qualifications

 

  • 5+ years of influencer, digital & social marketing experience driving talent partnerships and revenue growth
  • Experience in the sports, consumer tech and gaming industry is ideal 
  • Previously managed a team of 10 people
  • Managed over 1M+ budgets 
  • Strong understanding of influencer marketing and social media platforms including contract negotiations, content development and measurement
  • Expert knowledge of paid and organic influencer tactics 
  • Proficient in interpreting and applying where necessary information provided by influencer management software (such as Creator IQ, Klear, Tagger, Upfluence)
  • Excelling project management skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Works collaboratively with planning and creative teams to drive business outcomes
  • Expert grasp of social media platforms
  • Good understanding of paid and social amplification
  • Proficient with MS Office, Google or other presentation software
  • Robust experience with cross-channel integration

Nice to have:

  • Photoshop, Canva, animation, motion graphics
  • Certification in Facebook Blueprint, Twitter Flight School and/or Google Analytics
  • Social media tools like Sprout, Sprinklr, Hootsuite
  • CRM software like Hubspot
  • Meta software experience



Additional Information
 

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

results.title: Art Production Manager
results.description:
At Lockwood, our vision is to bring people together through Avakin Life so they can play, share and socialise! Listed as one of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies by the FT our journey’s only just begun. With great benefits including an employee share scheme and profit related quarterly bonus we’re always looking for talented individuals to join team. This is a great opportunity to be at the forefront of an exciting new direction for Lockwood, driving the growth of our products as well as being a driving force for improving processes and delivery framework.

The Art Production Manager is crucial to facilitating the creation of high-quality content for our product, Avakin Life. You will be an experienced production manager in art production, reporting into the Head of Content Production. Working closely alongside the Head of Content Production, Associate Art Director, Creative Director, and the Central Production Team, you will understand the processes and pipeline for art production of internal and external with outsourcing partners, define dependencies, issues and blockers, and implement the mitigation plans to resolve those. You will bring structure to our creative teams while collaborating with the project leadership and other disciplines to maintain communication in all directions.

We trust our Art Production Manager to ensure that assets are delivered on time; with quality, within budget and adhere to established pipelines. You are proactive in monitoring the content creation process from concept to build and beyond, working to mitigate production issues should they arise.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

Responsibilities

 

  • POC for content production
  • Work closely with the Head of Content production to implement strategic initiatives, product and department goals
  • Quarterly ideation and planning with the art teams and producers
  • Planning and delivery of art assets requirements for product features
  • Support the art teams with planning, tracking and delivery of high volume and quality art asset releases
  • Anticipate and address potential problems like resource blockers, quality concerns, schedule and scope changes.
  • Support the team to maintain and deliver art direction and requirements set by Associate Art director and Content Directors
  • Work with content producers to align delivery of art and in game experiences for our players
  • Support content leads with artist assignment & sign off process
  • Support Content publishing team in case of issues with art assets or asset pipeline process.
  • Risk and (cross team) dependency management
  • Close collaboration and support of publishing team and QA to meet release deadlines
  • Forecasting and planning of Outsource requirements
  • Coordinate assignments, asset delivery, feedback and bug fixing
  • Support creation of outsource material and briefs
  • Work with OS partner to continuously improve quality of asset delivery
  • Ensure art pipeline and teams are setup efficiently
  • Improving pipelines, methods and the appropriate use of skills within the team to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Art Production
  • Identify and communicate art tool requirements and support planning, review and testing of art tools
  • Support art review and sign off process

 

Requirements

  • Significant art management experience working in a multi-national game production environment
  • In depth knowledge of 3D character and environment pipeline and processes
  • Planning high volume art asset and releases
  • Outsource management experience
  • Attention to details whilst not losing sight of the big picture
  • Agile mindset and ability to quickly adapt to changes
  • Change management experience
  • Agile practices
  • excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Familiar with several project management and bug tracking software (e.g. Jira)

 

Desirables

 

  • Metaverse experience
  • Live Ops experience
  • Background as a 3D artist
  • Line management experience

results.title: Senior Technical Artist
results.description:
At Lockwood, our vision is to bring people together through Avakin Life so they can play, share and socialise! Listed as one of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies by the FT for 2020 as well as winning numerous TIGA and other awards several years in a row, our journey’s only just begun. With great benefits including an employee share scheme and profit related quarterly bonus, we’re a great destination for those who want to work on cutting edge social experiences in an environment that fosters communication and creativity. We’re always looking for good people – so if you’re a great person and an amazing developer we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for an awesome senior technical artist who has a solid background within mobile app/game development and experience of art pipelines, workflows and build processes. The role will involve working with our content, build and engineering teams, and maintaining/improving/reimagining our existing processes, pipelines and tooling.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with various teams throughout Lockwood to support existing processes and plan out improvements as needed.
  • Promote and adhere to best-practice with regards to art workflows; and continuously work to minimise technical and maintenance issues.
  • Collaborate with Leads and the Product team to help plan and schedule tasks with product releases;
  • Identify risks and provide relevant solutions in existing and new features / functionality.
  • Work alongside content teams to refine existing, and develop new pipelines and tooling for effective creation of content
  • Provide expert insight with our QA teams to identify and fix content issues in a timely manner;



Requirements

  • Significant technical art experience developing games, mobile applications or similar products.
  • Experience of shipping at least one game or mobile application
  • Excellent communication skills; you must be comfortable collaborating with colleagues from both programming and non-programming disciplines
  • Experience in working with art pipelines: environment, character, animations.
  • Experience with shaders across mobile and desktop platforms.
  • Knowledge of build/CI and maintaining/implementing art pipelines
  • Eliciting requirements from non-technical stakeholders e.g. content, product owners.
  • Desirables: Unity3D, C#, C++, Python/MayaScript, Experience working on a live product, Experience with Jenkins, and Git/Perforce/SVN, Great communication skills, friendly, open minded, positive, self-motivated and proactive.

results.title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst
results.description:
Senior Healthcare Data Analyst 
Irvine, CA / Glendale, CA / Columbus, OH
Remote Opportunity 

Do you like innovation and technology? We do, too. Reveleer is a healthcare software company serving health plans and care management organizations. Our teams are dedicated to disrupting and modernizing healthcare by building powerful technology that provides an amazing user experience, scalability, and automation. 

Reveleer is the first of its kind in our space – a self-service platform that mines health data using AI, NLP, and advanced analytics. Our Platform enables health plans to focus on the quality of care people receive, leaving the most complex and repetitive tasks for technology to solve. Be part of what Reveleer is building next! 

As the Senior Healthcare Data Analyst, your primary responsibility will be to partner with internal teams and customers with onboarding programs to the Reveleer platform. Programs include, but not limited to Risk Adjustment Initiatives, HEDIS Quality Programs and CMS Government Audits, CMS Enrollment and Encounter submissions, etc. The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst will help to ensure a smooth exchange of data between our healthcare clients. 

We're a hardworking, energetic team that is passionate about our customers and believes that to be successful we should never stop learning: learning about our customers, our product, and how to build better software. 

What You'll Do: 

  • Work with internal and external customers to map, transform, validate and load customer data for all products.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data issues for prompt and accurate data loads.
  • Research data questions, create ad-hoc reports, etc
  • Work with internal and external customs to map, create, QA and implement data extracts for all products. 

About You:

  • Experience with US Healthcare / Managed Care Organizations, specifically around Compliance and RISK Assessments programs
  • Working knowledge of healthcare industry and health data (provider demographics, patient data, Quality/Risk program information, compliance standards) is strongly preferred with background specific to quality measures (HEDIS), risk adjustment, and medical record review or audit
  • Comfortable working with data tools: Microsoft SQL, Excel. Preferred:
  • Experience working on SaaS web applications 

What You'll Receive:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
  • 401k
  • PTO Plan
  • Fully stocked breakroom with drinks and snacks
  • Dog friendly office
  • Social gatherings 

Reveleer is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis or race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

results.title: Senior Marketing & Communications Lead
results.description:
About Tre'dish 

The hospitality industry is fundamentally broken, with people working incredibly long and uncertain hours, on low wages, with huge overheads. Tre'dish is reinventing this industry by empowering people around the world to create successful businesses right from their own home. All you need is one great recipe, and we provide you with everything required to become a successful food entrepreneur; turning your kitchen into a steady income stream, while establishing your brand both digitally and throughout your community.  

We have launched locations in California and will be expanding our SAAS platform and affiliated marketplace across North America in the coming months with Canada being our core focus area.  

You can watch a short video explaining our business model here, and find out more about us at https://tredish.com/about and https://www.forbes.com/sites/davidprosser/2021/11/03/how-tredish-plans-to-empower-a-worldwide-army-of-home-chefs/?sh=2765a78e2884 

 

About the Role 

We're looking for a Senior Marketing and Communications Lead to join Tre'dish and help launch an exciting purpose driven brand to multiple markets within Canada and the US with the GTA being our key initial launch region. You'll be working closely with the leadership team, a small marketing and content team and other stakeholders to help design and execute our marketing and communications strategy. The key focus will be the execution of an omni channel campaign strategy to ensure our impact thesis and value proposition receives earned media attention and every touch point with our marketing, digital, customer acquisition and loyalty campaigns are fully connected and integrated. 

We are a fully remote team with colleagues across North America with our main presence and team being located in Toronto and Mississauga, ON.   

 

What You'll Do
  • Help develop and execute some of our most exciting marketing and content properties with a key focus on building and launching a national philanthropic impact-entrepreneurship marketing & sponsorship campaign 
  • Work alongside a team of advisors, agencies, and internal team members to build and execute our omni channel campaign and marketing strategy 
  • Design, launch & optimize tactics and experiments across the funnel to effectively scale results 
  • Measure and refine key KPIs and tracking metrics associated with campaign success to influence future decision making 
What We're Looking For
  • Proven experience in omni channel marketing; including digital, experiential, demand generation, customer acquisition, retention & loyalty and marketing communications (championing our brand voice) 
  • Experience launching a new product or property, campaign planning & execution, goal setting, and building marketing roadmaps 
  • Mission driven individuals who care about delivering impact. Our team is built with individuals who care about solving issues in hospitality including; creating new hospitality careers, creating accessible and affordable food, and empowering small business owners 
  • An outside-of-the-box thinker that brings creative ideas to the table 
  • Comfortable working and collaborating in cross functional teams; integrating yourself within a team of marketers, engineers, chefs & food industry professionals, designers, data scientists, etc. 
  • Self-motivated, comfortable working independently and a desire to learn quickly and take risks 
Bonus, if you have experience: 
  • In an impact-driven organization or early startup culture 
  • Supporting and/or managing PR campaigns & partners, specifically leading comms and ensuring connectivity to omni-channel marketing campaigns 
  • Working alongside product & design teams to optimize user journeys and create world-class user experiences 
  • Understanding of web & mobile analytics, paid media campaign development & management 
  • Planning & executing on social platforms. Including, but not limited to: TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube 
  • Building and executing B2B marketing, account-based marketing, channel marketing, and/or partnership marketing strategies  

We are looking for a talented individual who cares about empowering the next generation of food entrepreneurs and providing an incredible experience for our customers and partners. This is a special opportunity to build a platform and movement impacting millions of lives and changing the world for the better. 

We believe our team should be as diverse as the entrepreneurs and customers we work with. There's zero judgement when it comes to the things that make you who you are – whether that's your gender, race, religion or sexuality. If you feel you'd be good at the job, please reach out to us.

results.title: Senior GCP Cloud Architect
results.description:
We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for a Senior GCP Cloud Architect.

Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud. 

Your daily work:

  • Participating in various customer projects, from new infrastructure builds and migrations to audits and big data
  • Implementing configuration management infrastructure
  • Giving workshops and designing recommendations for a technical team
  • You'll become a trusted advisor for high-profile enterprise businesses and jointly manage the customer relationship and roadmap with the Nordcloud Sales team
  • You'll have a selection of different ‘hats' to put on and have the luxury of following customer projects from start to release

Your skills and attributes of success:

  • Hands-on experience with Cloud Architecture Design and/or Cloud Architectural Patterns for Development
  • Advanced knowledge of at least one of the following platforms: Google Cloud Platform (AWS is a plus)
  • Solid engineering/technical background/hands-on experience with conceptualizing, strategizing, and architecting cloud solutions
  • Windows and/or Linux sys op background
  • Previous experience in the design and delivery of systems based on IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS offerings, as well as exposure to different architecture models
  • DevOps skills for leading the team and consulting the customer
  • Experience with building CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of security, network, virtualization, load balancer, storage, and database
  • Container technologies experience (e.g. Kubernetes, OpenShift)
  • Hands-on experience with IaaC for managing the cloud
  • Coding/scripting skills (Bash, Python, Powershell, or similar)
  • Active customer consultant and pre-sales attitude are a must
  • Fluent communication skills in English and Finnish

As we have varying opportunities to work internationally, some readiness to travel within Finland and other locations in Europe is required.

All in all, you have a solid engineering or technical background with hands-on experience in conceptualizing, strategizing, and architecting cloud solutions. As you work with customers, solid social skills are a must. To us delivering quality solutions is more important than just “getting the job done”.

What do we offer in return?

  • A highly skilled multinational team
  • Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, GCP) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
  • Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
  • Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
  • Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Finland
  • Local benefits such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits

Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland.

Learn more about #NordcloudCommunity. If you'd like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.

About Nordcloud 

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It's a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects.

Learn more at nordcloud.com

results.title: Staff Full Stack Software Engineer
results.description:
Role summary

As a member of our engineering team, you will work closely with product management, business stakeholders, customer support, and engineering colleagues to develop critical product features and integrate with third-party services in the IoT and energy market spaces.

OhmConnect is expanding internationally, bringing our service to new markets in the United States, Canada, and Australia. Your work will directly support this expansion by building features that meet the needs of a growing and geographically diverse user base, supporting integration with new energy markets, and onboarding new marketing and product partners. You can expect your work to touch the lives and homes of millions of people in the US, Canada, and Australia.

 

Who we are

OhmConnect was founded to improve the lives of people and the health of the planet by reimagining the way we use energy. We are solving massive inefficiencies in energy markets, changing how people use and view energy, and connecting smart homes with the smart grid. We build products that connect deeply with consumers and invite them to take action to positively impact the planet, their communities, and their wallets.

We are an Equal Opportunity employer striving to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment where everyone feels that they have a voice that is heard.

 

What we do

Our products encompass:

  • Consumer facing applications that use home automation control and user behavior modeling to shape consumer energy consumption.
  • Integrations with a growing set of devices and appliances - smart plugs, thermostats, EV chargers, air conditioning, water heaters, etc.
  • Smart Meter data ingestion and analysis for consumer consumption forecast.
  • Bidding, monitoring and settlement processes for energy markets.

What you will do
  • Design, develop, test and deploy new code and maintain existing code.
  • Lead application development projects through all lifecycle stages: from ideation through implementation and to end-of-life from a technical perspective.
  • Monitor application performance: raise, prioritize, and manage issue resolution activities.
  • Work on all aspects of our stack: Python (Flask), MySQL, Javascript (React, TypeScript), GraphQL, Celery, AWS (EC2, ELB, RDS, Redshift, S3, SQS, SES, etc), Ubuntu, Apache, Redis, Git (GitHub), Jira.
  • Perform peer code review and support our Customer Experience team on technical issues, mentor junior developers.
  • Participate in our agile development process - regular team updates, standup meetings, 1-on-1’s.

Requirements

  • Knowledge of server-side languages, especially Python.
  • Solid understanding of SQL databases.
  • Experience with front-end web development — HTML, CSS and Javascript / JQuery. Knowledge of React and GraphQL are a plus.
  • A “systems” mindset: the ability to generalize and apply solutions to a broad set of problems.
  • Dedication to writing clean, robust code, with good unit test coverage.
  • Self-driven, curious, results-oriented; able to thrive in a remote environment.
  • Enjoy a fun, fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Desire for a career that makes an impact through our mission to rally people to change how and when they use electricity — unlocking clean, affordable and reliable energy.
  • Excellent 1-on-1 and team communication skills.
  • Reliability, follow-through, and the technical know-how to solve complex problems independently and share that knowledge with others.
  • 8+ years software development experience preferred.

Benefits

  • A competitive salary based on experience.
  • Fully remote work environment with home office set-up allowance.
  • Real and lived work-life balance - Company perks include unlimited vacation (which our C-level team actively encourages everyone to take!), parental leave, and a corporate values of working sustainably and putting families first.
  • Competitive benefits package that includes full suite of wellness benefits and stock options.
  • Opportunity to work with amazing people who are passionate about halting climate change, thriving in a fully-remote work environment, and learning and growing every day.

Not eligible for visa sponsorship.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

results.title: DevOps Software Engineer/Site Reliability Engineer
results.description:
Job Description 
Grayshift is looking to expand our team with a DevOps Software Engineer/Site Reliability Engineer! In this role, you will help modernize, automate, and maintain our product, the GrayKey, hardware provisioning process. You will also get to collaborate with our very technically talented Engineers with brainstorming new ways to elevate the GrayKey. If you enjoy concocting “outside-the-box" ideas, you will thrive here.  

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated individual with a passion for building scalable solutions and software. Love to build? Have fun creating amazing solutions? The Grayshift team is here to embrace your creativity.  

Primarily Remote Role based in the United States (HQ is in Atlanta, GA).  

Responsibilities: 

  • Design robust, maintainable, scalable provisioning solutions; 
  • Implement and integrate automated systems to provision, test, and deploy software; 
  • Scope and specify hardware and software and required to build, test, and deploy software; 
  • Create tools in support of Development Team requirements; 
  • Take initiative, build strong teams, communicate effectively; 
  • Work closely with software development teams; 
  • Perform other duties as assigned. 

Requirements: 

  • 2+ years of experience in DevOps or SRE roles; 
  • Proficient in Linux system administration; 
  • Proficient with Linux embedded devices and encrypted operating system deployments; 
  • Proficient in Python and bash shell scripting; 
  • Proficient with Build tools (make, BuildEsentials, NodeJS, Python); 
  • Experience using GitLab, Gitlab CI/CD, Pipelines, and Compliance Framework; 
  • Experience with NEXUS and S3 repositories; 
  • Experience creating and maintaining pipelines with multiple runner configurations; 
  • Experience with virtualization technologies including KVM, VMWare, VirtualBox; 
  • Experience with containerized applications and infrastructure (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.); 
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer; Engineering, or equivalent experience; 
  • Knowledge of the hardware architectures (IE: ARM, ARM64, X86_64); 
  • Travel <10%. 

Nice to Have: 

  • 1+ years of Amazon Web Services (AWS); 
  • Proficient in Infrastructure as Code tooling (Terraform, CloudFormation, etc.).  

Compensation and Perks:

  • Competitive compensation;
  • Our benefit package includes remote friendly work environment, healthcare on first-day, 100% Medical, dental, vision for self and family, training allocation and continuous learning, paid maternity & parental leave, other voluntary benefit plans like pet insurance, 401k, and $350 monthly stipend for mobile, internet and wellness membership;
  • Paid Time Off (PTO) includes 15 days plus 3 separate sick days, 2 personal/wellness days, and 13 paid holidays.

About Us

Grayshift is a leading provider of mobile device digital forensics. Grayshift solutions are purpose-built to help law enforcement and government investigative agencies swiftly resolve critical investigations and ensure public safety. The company’s innovative GrayKey technology provides rapid access, complete control, and comprehensive data extraction from mobile devices. Designed and assembled in the United States, GrayKey is trusted by 1000 agencies across more than 25 countries globally.

Our Culture

At Grayshift, we are a team of passionate thinkers who value creating digital forensic solutions that enable law enforcement agencies to swiftly resolve critical investigations and ensure public safety. Our team is empowered and collaborative and we move at the speed of a startup. We are constantly taking new learnings and building them into our products and services. 

As a Grayshifter, you can expect to make a difference through your work, connected to a meaningful mission, to be supported with learning and development, and to know that people are the heart of our company. We understand achieving a mission as important as ours requires teamwork, integrity, and incredible talent. If joining a team of people dedicated to addressing our customers’ most complex challenges appeals to you, come join us!

Grayshift is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.

All offers of employment at Grayshift are contingent upon satisfactory completion of a background check. All background checks will be conducted in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and other applicable laws.  Grayshift will consider each position’s job duties, among other factors, in determining what constitutes satisfactory completion of the background check.  Refusal to consent to a background check may be ground for revoking an offer of employment.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Early-stage venture-backed startup looking for the first full cycle Account Executive to support our VP of Sales and the early sales foundation and growth. A good fit if you like moving fast, having an impact, working on a variety of different things, and thanks to all of that learning a lot.



📍Where do you come in?

You will help Rob (our experienced Sales leader) shape and lead a sales function, build processes and ways of working and be a fundamental, landing revenue team member. Coaching & training is at the forefront of everything we do. Improving you as a salesperson is going to be Rob's number 1 priority.

We have many quality inbounds, so your role will be a mix of outbound to our target accounts, converting existing high-intent opportunities, and finding and uncovering new ones amongst our 1000s of freemium customers. Survicate offers the fastest time-to-value on the market, so you can expect closing deals in days or weeks, not months.



🎯 The impact you’ll make by joining us:

Within 1 month you’ll:

  • Be embedded in our sales process and philosophy - from outbound to running a sale you’ll have a clear understanding of the “jobs to be done” and the strategies we use to support them.

  • Start running your own sales cycles alongside senior management to make sure you’re confident and up to speed quickly

  • Become confident and clear in how we use content and cadences to build pipelines and have generated your own to start working with.

Within 3 months you’ll:

  • Start closing your first deals and making a material impact on our revenue.

  • Funnel feedback from prospects and customers to our product team and help us shape our roadmap

Within 6+ months you’ll (and as we are still an early-stage startup – this might change pretty a lot in the time):

  • Deliver value to our prospects, help us continuously educate the market, and as a result consistently meet or exceed your quota.

  • Come up with some sales operations suggestions – we’re constantly focusing on ways to be more efficient and optimizing our sales flow is key to this

💪 Skills you’ll need:

  • Bring the knowledge and experience with modern + innovative ways of engaging with prospects and customers

  • Clear and concise communication + presentation skills and a huge drive to make an immediate impact

  • An understanding of SaaS structures – we are building a SaaS for SaaS!

➕ What are the special areas you can learn here:

  • How to run an effective modern sales process with a huge focus on discovery and influencing vs. assisting a sale.
  • How to scale an early-stage business, be a core part of the strategy for how we build revenue and the teams to support it.
  • Evolving Outbound strategies in a world where buyer consideration is much more informed.

🤔 Why this role might not be a fit?

  • You aren’t interested in an early-stage startup environment. We care a lot about our team members and we try to avoid the chaos of the popular caricatures of startups. That being said, we seek to move quickly, we seek to do what’s best for our customers (sometimes without a lot of guidance), and you’ll be more resource-constrained than working at a larger company (e.g., Facebook, Google). In these big tech companies your base compensation might be also a bit higher though your efforts can much more directly impact how valuable the equity upside is here. That environment might be exciting – or it might not align with what you’re looking for.
  • You’re uncomfortable with change and ambiguity. Don't take us wrong. It doesn't mean we are changing foundational stuff every second day. No! We are really trying to build a solid foundation and keep building on top of that. We are just saying – if we all do our jobs well, the company will continue to grow rapidly. And that might mean your role will likely shift in scope to accommodate that growth and that new challenges will emerge that we don’t yet have the answers to. Depending on what you’re looking for, that dynamic may not be a fit (which is OK)!

🤝  Who you’ll be working with?

Rob is our VP of Sales (ex-Segment sales leader) and he is the one you would be reporting to and working closely the most with. Outside of this we’re *building* a team - we hope for you to have 4-5 teammates quickly for you to work with and excel alongside it!

 

FINANCE 💸:

Salary of PLN 10,000 to PLN 15,000 net + VAT (on target salary)💰
Commission is uncapped!

 

👋 Why Survicate?

  • Amazing Clients – we have the best Clients in the world, and it’s not a joke!
  • The real impact on shaping the future of communication with our Clients
  • Flexible working hours
  • 26 days of paid annual leave for all employees
  • Personal Development Budget - budget for online courses, books, conferences, language lessons
  • Professional Skills Development Budget
  • Company events 
  • Personal assistant (AskHenry) & mental health support platform (HearMe)
  • Multisport cards, PetHelp, private health care & benefit platform
  • Fair salary (base + bonus)
  • MacBook (or your preferred laptop)
  • Regular recognition, gifts, and awards
  • Friendly atmosphere and a great team
  • ... and many more to come as we listen to your needs!

results.title: Senior Product Manager - Billing
results.description:

No longer do employers have to hire according to geography, and no longer do employees have to worry about proximity to work and daily commutes. Today, companies can hire the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world. But they need digital solutions to help them streamline the process...

We're looking for someone who has:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems
  • Good to have previous work experience in HR / Compliance space

results.title: Product Designer, Analytics
results.description:
Company Description

We believe that now is the time to reevaluate the impact of spaces we create to live, work, and play. Building sustainably at a global scale requires better tools and technology for the people involved. We're attacking this at the core -- Outer Labs provides modern human-centric apps for stakeholders who can directly influence the way real estate, architecture, and construction decisions are made in their projects.

Some questions we find ourselves asking: ​How can we help an Architect explore thousands of ideas in the time it currently takes to explore one? How can software optimize the quality of space for usability while reducing the cost and resources required to build?​ How do we encourage adoption of reusable solutions that can be manufactured more sustainably and efficiently?

Answers to these questions require deep expertise in design and engineering that comes from every level of our company. This is why we’ve invested deeply in building a culture that empowers its employees to do great work and directly shape the future of its products. We want smart, creative, and intentional individuals to be part of our core team. Are you in?



Job Description

As a Product Designer for Analytics, you’ll work on a wide variety of challenging problems across a portfolio of clients and internal R+D efforts. Your core focus will be creating analytical tools that real estate owner teams are using for strategic planning and forecasting.

You’ll work directly with our clients who own and operate large occupant-focused real estate portfolios. You’ll leverage the insight of our product managers and strategists to build a point of view for the user, then bring your designs to life with our world-class engineering team using the latest and greatest technology. As part of a growing team, you’ll also get to shape the design culture at Outer Labs and directly influence the process of design and innovation.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with Product Strategists to gather design research and market analysis for use in addressing stakeholder perspectives
  • Partner with Product Management, Product Strategy, and Engineering project team members to develop a user-centric point of view for the product.
  • Express design intent with high-quality mockups and clickable prototypes that embody the end-to-end user journey.
  • Leverage the full range of design expertise at Outer Labs by working closely with other designers to sharpen your intuition and iterate through your designs.
  • Facilitate the handoff of design requirements, clickable prototypes, and assets to developers by working closely with Product Managers and Engineering lead.
  • Advocate for user experience, field questions, and make adjustments as you work throughout the implementation phase.
  • Ensure the final result provides the intended value to stakeholders by responding to feedback and making adjustments as needed.


Qualifications
  • Relevant experience and portfolio working as a Product Designer, User Experience (UX) Designer, or similar role
  • Deep knowledge of user experience research and market analysis frameworks
  • Experience building and iterating on user journeys from design research
  • Experience wireframing, designing and prototyping in Figma, or similar application
  • Excellent eye for aesthetic design and latest design trends
  • Understanding of UX patterns and ability to work with Design Systems
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Driven by curiosity with exceptional attention to detail
  • Preference for fast-paced iteration, deadlines, and budgets
  • Experience with AEC industry is preferred


Additional Information

Benefits

  • Healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for employee & dependents.  We cover 85% of the cost for employee, and 75% of the cost for dependents

  • 401K with matching up to 4% of your salary

  • Paid parental leave for all new parents

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 11 paid company holidays

  • Computer and home office setup with phone and internet paid for up to $100 each.

  • Annual stipend for education and professional development

  • 100% remote working

 

Outer Labs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Cloud FinOps manager (LTG)

[Job Description] 
We are looking for a community manager who is passionate about web3/crypto and joining a team of enthusiastic professionals who strive for out-of-the-box solutions. If you join us, you'll:
  • Create a DAO for web3 professionals at the intersection of work and learning in collaboration with engineers, designers, business developers, and marketers from across the organization
  • Get comprehensive exposure to the latest blockchain-based technologies (web3, DAO, NFT, DeFi, Metaverse) and implement your idea into practice on a daily basis
  • Collaborate with crypto gurus at corporates, start-ups, global venture capitals, peers with project/investment portfolios in NEAR, Klaytn, Terra, CryptoPunks, BAYC, etc., and a tech professional network of over 3,000+ people

[Responsibilities]


  • Manage and monitor multiple channels including Wiki, Discord, Tweeter, Medium, etc. providing engaging contents and responding to comments & queries in timely manner
  • Organize and actively participate in events to build and boost States DAO community
  • Create educational content to improve onboarding and understanding of States DAO
  • Track and interpret relevant community metrics (community engagement metrics)
  • Moderate online and offline conversations with our community with great ‘people' skills

[Qualifications]
  • Tech-savvy professional, experienced in social media, PR, and promotional events with 1+ year of experience launching community initiatives (preferably in the crypto/web3 field)
  • Actively participating in (or eager to) communities, networks, and services in the blockchain field
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills to develop engaging content
